event.title: June 2006, the director of the U.S. Fish and wildlife service gave

data.event: In June 2006, the director of the U.S. Fish and wildlife service gave approval to the Neches River National Wildlife Refuge on a beautiful stretch of the upper Neches River in Anderson and Cherokee counties.

event.title: August, the Refuge was officially established

data.event: With the donation of the first acre of land to the refuge the following August, the Refuge was officially established.

event.title: Now the Texas water development board and the city of Dallas, who want

data.event: Now the Texas water development board and the city of Dallas, who want to build a reservoir on the Refuge site, are suing the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service to try and overturn the Refuge.
The monthly meeting of the East Texas Environmental Concerns Organization will be at 6 p.m. Monday at First Presbyterian Church in Athens.
